intro: Ohigginsia refulgens f. argyroneura, commonly known as the silver-haired ohigginsia, is a rare and striking plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its silvery, velvety foliage, which gives it its distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, known for its aromatic herbs and umbellate flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs that reflect light, contributing to its shimmering effect. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
